comments.body: Pretty sure they will..
Even if you only allow 4 or something please do this. I'm begging.

If they did this, then people would put their shulker boxes into the bundles. Since bundles hold 64, and a whole inventory has 36 slots and shulkers have 27 slots. 36 x 64 x 27 = 62208 items. Since each one of those items could and probably will stack to 64, then steve could theoretically hold (62208 x 64) 3981312 items... Correct me if I have made any mistake in these calculations.
This is cool in theory, but the blue copper tools might be confused with diamond tools even if the shade of blue is different. Neat idea though!
They could rust over time like the blocks do and turn green.
they should also cause a status effect called tetanus which would have the D.O.T effect
Maybe you can wax them to preserve there weathered state

It makes the telescope more interesting, so hey! Of course it should also have a limit, maybe like only the chunk you're in and the ones touching it or something, or maybe like in a 32 block radius around you or something.

It provides a whole new use of the spyglass which is pretty useful, especially since you have to actually do a lot of caving in order to get one, which is good! Obviously if this were taken verbatim it would likely be overpowered, so what if you have to first look at the npc/player entity through the spyglass normally, in order for the effect to work. Then as long as you keep looking through the spyglass, you'll be able to see the entity in spectral view. This will stop the moment you stop looking through it, meaning in order to see the entity again, you have to look through the spectral spyglass normally. Also the other thing I would change, would be not having the zoom mechanic for this.

This should be an enchantment for the telescope rather than a seporate item.

There should be further enchantments that change zoom level, give temporary night vision, and reveal invisible mobs/players
Adem√°s, deben de apagarse mediante redstone, si no me equivoco, no hay
I would really like this feature. Perhaps they could even be toggled on the rising edge of a redstone signal.
Great idea!
The devs said that at least one piglin bartering item had to be partially unique and uncraftable. They could make a new unique replacement like a totem of fire resistance, then implement your idea.
you should make crying obsidian be able to be different colors by using dyes.
This is a great suggestion! ive been thinking this since 1.14 released

That way you can have a redstone build or a chicken farm and not want to place tnt in it! It will be better if you combined it with certain blocks so that it doesn't need with your theme, like put it in a crafting table with a oak block and you get nose cancelling oak block. I like that idea.
Cool idea! Maybe make it to where ppl outside can‚Äôt hear what‚Äôs inside so if u have friends that hate music discs that u play u can play them in ur secret base.
Yes please. It's one of my favorite modded features. If (maybe) carpets or wool would dampen the sound it may be a way to achieve this.
Sponge
I love this!! Like a sound sponge
üëç
Que tal colocar uns animais da √Åfrica e o bioma da √Åfrica? :)

In the Bedrock Edition they are based on blocks, not entities, like the Java Edition & Legacy Console Editions, so I'm pretty sure it'd be incredibly difficult to implement, but I wish it was possible.
I need this feature
Yeah we do need this on bedrock... i don‚Äôt see why this has to be a Java only feature
I agree as well, only cause I want white rooms

We need this feature because it wasn't in bedrock.

And we had too many tricks with that
Villeicht verschmelzen?
Love the concept of the smithing table being used for slightly not just better but different armours
Interesting concept, but maybe not the Diamond armor, but the Leather or Chainmail? Because we already have Netherite for Diamond, while the other sets lack of an upgrading material
I think it would be a bit overpowered to have it be better than diamond. Maybe make it an upgrade to iron.
I like the enchantment idea better

Mojang might want to make a few changes to make this fairer, but other than that, this is good. If 3x3 is not an option, we could have tools that highlight or outline a 2x2x2 which is only 8 blocks compared to the 9 blocks of a 3x3

This is a good idea, how it is implementation via, Neterite tools, enchantments or a new tool like a wand is up to the devs, but it would be a great addition. I would like 3x3 2x3 1x3 and the ability to place more than one block at a time. Theres loads of mod examples of this and would benefit Minecraft Vanilla as it would allow for larger and more creative builds. For creative and survival modes.

I think this would be awesome, especially if it was implemented in a way similar to the Easy Emerald Tools and More mod, where these extra tools have to be crafted with like a whole block of whatever type of tool it is. For example, to make an iron hatchet, you would have to have a whole iron block in the recipe.

I had a very similar idea that I was gonna post though I gave it a couple different features as well. Here is my pitch
A flint and netherite. This creates longer lasting and stronger fire that can spread on stuff that fire normally can't like grass blocks, nether rack the nether wood should be fire resistant except to fire from a flint and nether rite. It also is purple on soul sand and soil and is a darker red normally. As well as it would take longer to naturally stop burning if you step in it.
Then in the hopefully near future when we finally get a new dimension you will have to use this flint and steel variant to activate the portal. Speaking of portals you could use this to change the links of specific nether portals. So you could have 3 portals in the over world all go to 1 portal in the nether or 3 portals in the nether go to 1 in the over world.

Not sold on a new dimension, but a normal flint and steel creating only orange/red fire, and a netherite flint and steel being able to create blue fire is an awesome idea. I was going to post this myself, but decided it would be better just to comment on this one. It would give players another reason to go to the nether and gather netherite. A cosmetic and building reason. Netherite blocks are cool, but too expensive. Blue fire being able to be put on more than just soul sand would be a great thing.
Or you could use the new chains.
This would be nice for 1.20 with the hanging signs as d√©cor.
It would be great if you could stick it to walls, ceilings and the things the others said.
Agreed, it would make slime/honey block contraptions less ugly. (so long as the undyed variant has no pattern)

Would it also have the same piston functionality that slime and honey blocks have? And would it not stick to either? If so, this could allow for contraptions just a bit more mad than what honey blocks would allow for, which I'm more than open to.
Yes, but add the piston functionality slime and honey blocks have, and make it so the three don't stick to each other. Love it!
Possibly a place to park your striders without them looking so miserable.

I like your idea. But it would be cool if users could make a potion of burning with magma cream blocks. It also would be cool if users could enchant tools with potions of burning making burning tools.
This is cool maybe once it breaks 5 soul swoopers spawn and attack the player!
I think it should be repaired by using the Swooper Membranes.
Thanks Makaneek! Very cool! (Actually tho very cool lol)
Great idea! üòç
Should fire resistance potions not be immune to soul fire if this is implemented?
I think this is a good idea. In fact, I think it should damage through ALL forms of fire resistance, including potions. It should be more like a magical flame instead of just a different color.
No, because it's still fire, even if a magic one
The dye system with the primary colors being red, blue, green, yellow, brown, and black is a bit messed up right now and 100% green and brown dye need better alternatives for being made.
I love that combining complimentary colors also gives you brown dye! This is a great idea.
Toilet, Refrigerator, Washer, Dryer, Microwave, Coffee Maker etc..

I am a 41yr old disabled mother who is addicted to building houses on Minecraft, & the part that I have the most difficulty with is finding something to use as a toilet & refrigerator. Would love to see these in an update soon.
Or it could leave wax.
Or it could just be a food source
I like this as a food source, but your effect idea seems silly. Maybe a temporary speed boost since this is a sugar!

I think it would be a better idea to have a short term regeneration. Like 5 seconds. Stinging and anything else would be ridiculous, with the right farm setup I get about 3 stacks of honeycomb a day. Either regeneration or speed. But that would be it. Or just a food that slowly regenerates food for 20 seconds
Maybe they could drop it.
Skeletons should not have an infinite supply of arrows.

After thinking about it I think this would actually look good and I would like to see it. However, skeletons have been relatively unchanged for Minecrafts entire life, changes like these usually don't happen.
Re: pics, I don't think it's actually needed to get the point across.You explained the idea well enough!
I can see this being a thing.
Make sure to vote for yourself.

While we're at it, the same argument pretty much applies to Ladders & Bookshelves as well. :)

 

SystemZee explained the bookshelf idea in this video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aRDXkHU55os&t=655s
It is a good idea, but this means we need different types of sticks due to their crafting recipe
@Some Animal I wouldn't think so seeing that Dark Oak Fences would be a bad combination with Birch Torches. The base of the Torch should adjust to the type of fence it's on.

@Blast Burner

Even if they 'adjusted' to whatever wood base they were attached to, there would be players who would want the different torches as different blocks so they could place them wherever they wanted.

But that was a nice idea, though. :)

Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

Why not instead of straight-up poisoning you (ivy doesn't do that), it poisons you when you eat something after coming in contact with ivy! To remove the latent 'ivy-poison', you have to bathe in water. That would be more realistic and would make players have to take more care
These blocks should be found in jungles and swamps to make them more dangerous.
I agree, at one point samurai actually used wooden armor. This would be in my opinion a welcomed addition.
It would make the armor feel more implemented into gameplay!
Hey, this is not terraria, I think you should first prove that you can get decent armor, but the idea for a mod would be nice
Although I agree with I have one question and that is how would this compare with leather armor
I agree because you could easily have a form of protection

I agree to you. That could be AWSOME for hardcore players.

I wanted it too
